alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 8:42PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bastrop and Lee Counties through 930 PM CST... At 841 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tanglewood to 7 miles southeast of Cedar Creek. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elgin, Bastrop, Giddings, Smithville, Lexington, Dime Box, Fedor, Paige, Tanglewood, Camp Swift, Circle D-KC Estates, Cedar Creek, Rosanky, Wyldwood, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Upton, Webberville, Knobb Springs, Phelan and Bastrop State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for south central Texas.
